title: 13 Flowers Foods bakeries attain 2022 ENERGY STAR certification - Snack Food & Wholesale Bakery
summary: Thirteen Flowers Foods, Inc. bakeries earned ENERGY STAR certification in 2022 for their energy efficiency performance.
green_innovation: TRUE The article describes how Flowers Foods bakeries achieved ENERGY STAR certification, showcasing their commitment to environmental sustainability and reducing energy consumption.
business_innovation: TRUE The article highlights how Flowers Foods improved their energy efficiency performance by receiving ENERGY STAR certification, demonstrating a new and significantly improved business process in their operations.
green_product: FALSE The article focuses on the energy efficiency and sustainability practices of Flowers Foods' bakeries, rather than a specific product.
green_process: TRUE The article highlights the green processes implemented by Flowers Foods' bakeries to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in their operations.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 551114 - Corporate, Subsidiary, and Regional Managing Offices, 551112 - Offices of Other Holding Companies, 311830 - Tortilla Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE The article does not involve making false or misleading statements about the environmental benefits of a product or practice. It mainly highlights the genuine sustainability efforts and achievements of Flowers Foods' bakeries.

title: Czechia refills rooftop PV rebate pot â€“ pv magazine International - pv magazine International
summary: The Czech Ministry of the Environment secured new funds from the European Union for its New Green Savings program, aiming to cut red tape and expand household participation. The program has seen a surge in applications for energy-saving subsidies, primarily for rooftop PV rebates. Additional funding from the Modernization Fund will support the program's enhancements and a more streamlined subsidy process.
green_innovation: TRUE The article discusses the implementation and expansion of the New Green Savings program, which promotes energy efficiency and renewable energy use, thus aligning with the concept of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE While the article describes government-funded programs like the New Green Savings, it does not focus on new or significantly improved products or processes brought to the market by a firm, so it does not meet the criteria of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE The rooftop PV rebates and subsidies for energy-saving modifications mentioned in the article contribute to the development of green products. These incentives encourage the adoption of environmentally friendly technologies and practices.
green_process: TRUE The article discusses the adoption of green processes within the New Green Savings program, such as simplifying procedures, relaxing criteria, and promoting energy-efficient solutions like heat pumps. These initiatives aim to reduce waste, conserve resources, and limit environmental impacts.
official_company_name: Ministry of the Environment of the Czech Republic
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 924110 - Administration of Environmental Quality Programs, 221114 - Solar Electric Power Generation, 236115 - New Single-Family Housing Construction (except Operative Builders), 236116 - New Multifamily Housing Construction (except Operative Builders)
greenwashing: FALSE The article focuses on the genuine efforts of the Czech Ministry of the Environment to enhance energy efficiency and promote renewable energy adoption rather than misleading environmental claims.
